chapter.title: Meaning of self-determination for adults with LD
chapter.content:
Meaning of self-determination for adults with LD

Our first guiding question asks:

What does it mean for an adult with LD to be self-determined?

We’ll address this question by examining the component parts of self-determination.

chapter.title: Six factors contributing to self-determination
chapter.content:
Six factors contributing to self-determination

We will explore self-determination by considering the six factors presented on this slide that affect an individual’s ability to be self-determined. Self determined individuals know how to:

  • gain self-awareness;
  • learn to value oneself;
  • plan;
  • be proactive;
  • reflect and readjust; and
  • adjust their environment.

chapter.title: Self-determination movement is rooted in self-understanding and self-appreciation
chapter.content:
Self-determination movement is rooted in self-understanding and self-appreciation

The self-determination movement in disability studies is particularly relevant to adults with LD because it is rooted in self-understanding and self-appreciation, two challenges we noted previously that are often faced by individuals with LD.

We will begin our exploration of self-determination by examining self-awareness.
